713520f-a.title: Manhattan: 51st Street - Lexington Avenue
713520f-a.text:
5lst Street, south side, from, but not including, Lexington
Avenue to and including Madison Avenue, seen across the excavation
for the 50-story General Electric Building. St. Bartholomew's
Protestant Episcopal Church is seen in the centre.
May 3, 1930.
P.L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

721025f-a.title: Manhattan: Lexington Avenue - 51st Street
721025f-a.text:
Lexington Ave., west side, south from East 52nd to 5lst Streets,
showing a new commercial and theatre structure under construction at
the S.W. corner of the first point. Upon this site originally stood
a Swedish M.E. Church, the sale of which was culminated in January 1937.
October 12, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

721022f-a.title: Manhattan: Lexington Avenue - 51st Street
721022f-a.text:
Lexington Avenue, at the S. E. corner of East 5lst
Street, showing Loew's Lexington Theatre (motion
picture). This was formerly the Lexington Avenue
Opera House. To the left appears an extensive
view eastward on the south side of East 51st Street.
Note thw ''E1' line on Third Avenue.
June 1925
MAY BE REPRODUCED

721024f-a.text:
582 Lexington Avenue, west side, between 51st and 52nd Streets.
About 1912.

713516f-a.title: Manhattan: 51st Street - Lexington Avenue
713516f-a.text:
5lst Street, south side, east from Lexington Av. This view
also shows Lexington Ave, east side, south from 51st Street.
About 1910.
BE REPRODUCED.

730397f-a.title: General view - [Manhattan - Lexington Avenue - 51st Street (East).]
730397f-a.text:
570 Lexington Avenue, (General Electric Builuing) at the
S. W. coner oh E. 5lst Street, (general view west).
Prominently shown are the No. 444 Madison Avenue, R. C. A.
and International Buildings and St. Patricks Catnedral. In
tne foreground is an apartment house bearing No. 320-33O Park
Avenue, and is on tne west side of same, ,between E. 50th and
blst Streets.
1936
W. P. A.
Federal Writers Project
CPEiIT LINE IMPERATIVE

713513f-a.title: Manhattan: 51st Street - Lexington Avenue
713513f-a.text:
51st Street, south side, from and including Lexington to
Third Avenues. The excavation for the 50-story General Electric
Building is seen in the foreground.
May 13, 1930.
P.L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

713519f-a.title: Manhattan: 51st Street - Lexington Avenue
713519f-a.text:
51st Street at the N.W. corner of Lexington Avenue, also
showing 576-588 Lexington Avenue, west side,from 51st Street to
south of 52nd Street.
May 3, 1930.
P.L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
